66+ hours in and I still don't really know what I am doing, but I am surviving.

I'm going to be honest.. I hate roleplaying games or heavily immersive games (example gta rp, arma, etc) but there's just something about this game that just scratch a very specific itch that I didn't know I needed. I got the game so that me and a few friends could suffer together for a bit and scream at each other because someone in the crew isn't doing their job correctly, to now having me be fully invested into the game and I WILL ensure I reach the end to see what is there. 60 hours in and we are still in zone 2 after immense trial and error, yet we're still finding new things and discover different things to do. If the game is bending us over this hard already then I don't even want to know what zone 3 and 4 has in store for us.

I think the main thing I don't like about the game though, while at the same time makes it enjoyable (idk how to explain it but it's like a love-hate relationship) so is it the character combat. It is difficult, but not just in the "you better come prepared" way, but also in the "WTF IS MY IDIOTIC FUCKING CHARACTER DOING JUST SHOOT OR SWING OH MY GOD I JUST KILLED A CREWMATE TRYING TO SHOOT THE ENEMY BECAUSE MY ARM WENT THROUGH THE MONSTER". It's this mix of being QWOP movement while also fully understanding just why the game is like this. As frustrating as it is, I am unsure if the game would even be the same without it. There's obviously some fixes to be had though.

Another thing is that there really isn't much talking, diaries, notes, etc that explains really anything. I don't mean guides, I mean lore. You go to an outpost and you got 4 different kinds of NPCs: merchant, random event chat, quest giver, stale npc that does nothing. Why can't I just walk up to someone and just have a chat about whatever? Why is it that absolutely every encounter, every chat just HAVE to have meaning to it. If I am allowed to talk to someone then it means they have a quest for me. Why can't I just have a dialogue about rumors to example? Give the game more life. Make it feel like I actually exist and is part of this universe. Currently so does it just feel like I am here to go from point A to point B and nothing else. The crew members you have got so much personality like different traits that change how they react to dialogue, why can't we have that with the outpost npc's too?

It just feels like I am a spectator to everything. I'm not allowed to initiate or talk to anyone myself. The funny bits with the crew members happen at random you can't force anything to happen.

That being said though everything else is great. Sub combat is satisfying and victory from a tough fight or reaching the outpost barely alive really gets the adrenaline pumping. 

I will never forget the first time we came across crawlers and they breached into the sub instantly and just completely mauled everyone onboard except one npc. We make it to the outpost and someone apparently ended up with a husk infection and absolute hell broke loose. That outpost ended up being world war 3. We're still recovering from that chaos. We may have been able to repair, resupply and gear up again, but mentally we're still scarred. We always got husk vaccines on board, never fight anything husk related without protection and we have a dedicated doctor to ensure and check that we aren't infected now. Thank you Barotrauma for giving me a core memory about the dangers of a virtual virus.
